content:
Summary of BET Surface Areas and Pore Volumes for MOFs Powder and Monoliths without Binders powder monolith MOFs surface area (m2/g) V total (cm3/g) surface area (m2/g) V total (cm3/g) ref MOF-74(Ni) 3398 2.43 652 0.73 UTSA-16(Co) 746 0.36 223 0.11 UiO-66 1167 0.47 Xerogel: 1459 Xerogel: 2.09 Aerogel: 1255 Aerogel: 1.66 MIL-100(Fe) 1183 V micro = 0.52 1618 V micro = 0.72 MOF-177 4100 1.65 2400 (compressed at 6 MPa) 1.05 CPO-27-Ni 1060 0.39 1050 (compressed at 100 MPa) 0.40 ZIF-8 1433 1420 (0.05 g/compressed at 5 kN) HKUST-1 1897 453 (0.05 g/compressed at 5 kN) ZIF-8 1983 0.76 1841 (compressed at 62 MPa) 0.70 1736 (compressed at 125 MPa) 0.67 MIL-53(Al) 796 0.42 432 (compressed at 62 MPa) 0.27 538 (compressed at 125 MPa) 0.32 MIL-101 3623 (ρ = 0.19 g/cm3) V total = 1.75 126–3381 0.017–1.67 Vmicro = 1.43

The density of the compressed pellets ranges from 1.34 to 0.344 g/cm3, corresponding to a BET surface area of 126–3381 m2/g.

The density of the compressed pellets ranges from 1.34 to 0.344 g/cm3, corresponding to a total pore volume of 10.017–1.67 cm–3/g.
clean_text:
Table 1. Summary of BET Surface Areas and Pore Volumes for MOFs Powder and Monoliths without Binders

| MOFs        | powder surface area (m²/g) | powder Vtotal (cm³/g) | monolith surface area (m²/g) | monolith Vtotal (cm³/g) | ref |
|-------------|-----------------------------|-----------------------|-------------------------------|-------------------------|-----|
| MOF-74(Ni)  | 3398                        | 2.43                  | 652                           | 0.73                    | [92]|
| UTSA-16(Co) | 746                         | 0.36                  | 223                           | 0.11                    |     |
| UiO-66      | 1167                        | 0.47                  | Xerogel: 1459                  | Xerogel: 2.09            | [105]|
|             |                             |                       | Aerogel: 1255                  | Aerogel: 1.66            |     |
| MIL-100(Fe) | 1183                        | Vmicro = 0.52         | 1618                          | Vmicro = 0.72            | [106]|
| MOF-177     | 4100                        | 1.65                  | 2400 (compressed at 6 MPa)     | 1.05                    | [115]|
| CPO-27-Ni   | 1060                        | 0.39                  | 1050 (compressed at 100 MPa)   | 0.40                    | [117]|
| ZIF-8       | 1433                        |                       | 1420 (0.05 g/compressed at 5 kN)|                         | [118]|
| HKUST-1     | 1897                        |                       | 453 (0.05 g/compressed at 5 kN)|                         |     |
| ZIF-8       | 1983                        | 0.76                  | 1841 (compressed at 62 MPa)    | 0.70                    | [119]|
|             |                             |                       | 1736 (compressed at 125 MPa)   | 0.67                    |     |
| MIL-53(Al)  | 796                         | 0.42                  | 432 (compressed at 62 MPa)     | 0.27                    |     |
|             |                             |                       | 538 (compressed at 125 MPa)    | 0.32                    |     |
| MIL-101     | 3623 (ρ = 0.19 g/cm³)        | Vtotal = 1.75         | 126–3381[^a]                   | 0.017–1.67[^b]           | [120]|
|             |                             | Vmicro = 1.43         |                               |                         |     |

[^a]: The density of the compressed pellets ranges from 1.34 to 0.344 g/cm³, corresponding to a BET surface area of 126–3381 m²/g.
[^b]: The density of the compressed pellets ranges from 1.34 to 0.344 g/cm³, corresponding to a total pore volume of 10.017–1.67 cm³/g.

Table 2. Summary of BET Surface Areas and Pore Volumes of MOFs Monoliths with Inorganic Binders

| MOFs        | inorganic binders | powder BET surface area (m²/g) | powder Vtotal (cm³/g) | monolith BET surface area (m²/g) | monolith Vtotal (cm³/g) | ref |
|-------------|--------------------|--------------------------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------|-------------------------|-----|
| MIL-100(Fe) | 5 wt % ρ-alumina   | 2088                           | 1.0                   | 1831                            | 0.9                     | [124] |
| MIL-101(Cr) |                    | 4066                           | 1.6                   | 3685                            | 1.6                     |       |
| UiO-66(Zr)  |                    | 1050                           | 1.5                   | 911                             | 0.9                     |       |
| UiO-66(Zr)_NH₂ |                  | 875                            | 1.6                   | 823                             | 1.0                     |       |
| MIL-100(Fe) | 10 wt % silica sol | 1772                           | 0.93                  | 1619                            | 0.82                    | [125] |
| UiO-66      | 1 wt % graphite    | 1140                           |                       | 885                             |                         | [126] |

content:
Summary of BET Surface Areas and Pore Volumes of 3D-Printed Monoliths and Powder Samples powder monolith MOFs additive BET surface area (m2/g) V total (cm3/g) BET surface area (m2/g) V total (cm3/g) ref MOF-74(Ni) 15 wt % bentonite + 5 wt % PVA 1180 V micro = 0.51 737 V micro = 0.32 UTSA-16(Co) 10 wt % clay + 5 wt % 727 V micro = 0.29 568 V micro = 0.23 ZIF-8 90 wt % ABS 1446 0.655 436 0.065 HKUST-1 90 wt % ABS 776 0.298 329 0.044 ZIF-8 16.7 wt % bentonite + 16.7 wt % methylcellulose 1415 0.5 1083 0.39 HKUST-1 gel 1850 1134 HKUST-1 87% CA-GE 1563 0.66 83 1.542 SNW-1 without additive 830 794

PVA: poly­(vinyl alcohol).

ABS: acrylonitrile butadiene styrene metal, S BET (ABS) = 332 m2/g.

CA–GE: calcium alginate and gelatin.

Powdery HKUST-1: V total = 0.66 cm3/g, V micro = 0.59 cm3/g, V meso = 0.071 cm3/g, V macro = nil. 3D-printed HKUST-1: V total = 1.542 cm3/g, V micro = 0.038 cm3/g, V meso = 0.018 cm3/g, V macro = 1.486 cm3/g.
clean_text:
Table 4. Summary of BET Surface Areas and Pore Volumes of 3D-Printed Monoliths and Powder Samples

| MOFs       | additive                                      | powder BET surface area (m²/g) | powder Vtotal (cm³/g) | monolith BET surface area (m²/g) | monolith Vtotal (cm³/g) | ref |
|------------|------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------|-----------------------|----------------------------------|-------------------------|-----|
| MOF-74(Ni) | 15 wt % bentonite + 5 wt % PVA[^a]             | 1180                           | Vmicro = 0.51          | 737                              | Vmicro = 0.32            | [155] |
| UTSA-16(Co)| 10 wt % clay + 5 wt %[^b]                      | 727                            | Vmicro = 0.29          | 568                              | Vmicro = 0.23            |      |
| ZIF-8      | 90 wt % ABS[^b]                                | 1446                           | 0.655                 | 436                              | 0.065                   | [159] |
| HKUST-1    | 90 wt % ABS                                    | 776                            | 0.298                 | 329                              | 0.044                   |      |
| ZIF-8      | 16.7 wt % bentonite + 16.7 wt % methylcellulose | 1415                           | 0.5                   | 1083                             | 0.39                    | [163] |
| HKUST-1    | gel                                            | 1850                           |                       | 1134                             |                         | [165] |
| HKUST-1    | 87% CA-GE[^c]                                   | 1563                           | 0.66                  | 83                               | 1.542[^d]               | [166] |
| SNW-1      | without additive                               | 830                            |                       | 794                              |                         | [167] |

[^a]: PVA: poly­(vinyl alcohol).
[^b]: ABS: acrylonitrile butadiene styrene metal, SBET (ABS) = 332 m²/g.
[^c]: CA–GE: calcium alginate and gelatin.
[^d]: Powdery HKUST-1: Vtotal = 0.66 cm³/g, Vmicro = 0.59 cm³/g, Vmeso = 0.071 cm³/g, Vmacro = nil. 3D-printed HKUST-1: Vtotal = 1.542 cm³/g, Vmicro = 0.038 cm³/g, Vmeso = 0.018 cm³/g, Vmacro = 1.486 cm³/g.
